etymology.interpretation: 糸 evokes threads and tying, pointing to meanings like knotting and binding. 吉 contributes the sound (OC 吉 *klid ~ 結 *kiːd) and by association can suggest an auspicious tying together or conclusion.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the left-side 糸 with 纟 under the standard silk-radical simplification; the phonetic 吉 was retained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我把绳子打结(我把繩子打結)。
examples.english: I tie a knot in the rope.

examples.chinese: 我们今天结婚(我們今天結婚)。
会议圆满结束(會議圓滿結束)。
